maml:description.maml:para: Installs a WSL PnPCandy\tool.
The Add-PnPWsl2Candy function installs WSL tools (Candy) by executing the specified scripts.
Specifies the WSL Instance to install the pnpcandy on. This parameter is mandatory.
Specifies the Candy\tool to install. This parameter is mandatory.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Specifies the WSL Instance to install the pnpcandy on. This parameter is mandatory.
Specifies the Candy\tool to install. This parameter is mandatory.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:remarks.maml:para: Installs PowerShell on the specified WSL Instance .

maml:description.maml:para: Adds a new WSL2 instance.

The Add-PnPWsl2Instance adds a new WSL2 instance with a specified distribution. Behind the scenes, it creates a folder in PnPWsl2/instances with the instance name and will export a backup of the current instance in the PnPWsl2/images folder
Specifies the distribution for the new WSL2 instance. This parameter is mandatory.
Specifies the name for the new WSL2 instance. This parameter is mandatory.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Specifies the distribution for the new WSL2 instance. This parameter is mandatory.
Specifies the name for the new WSL2 instance. This parameter is mandatory.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command adds a new WSL2 instance named "MyInstance" with the "Ubuntu-20.04" distribution.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new checkpoint of a WSL2 instance.
The CheckPoint-PnPWsl2Instance function creates a new checkpoint of a specified WSL2 instance.
Specifies the WSL2 instance to checkpoint. This parameter is mandatory.
Specifies the name of the checkpoint. This parameter is mandatory.
If this switch is provided, it will not prompt for confirmation before creating the checkpoint.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Specifies the WSL2 instance to checkpoint. This parameter is mandatory.
Specifies the name of the checkpoint. This parameter is mandatory.
If this switch is provided, it will not prompt for confirmation before creating the checkpoint.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates a new checkpoint of the "Ubuntu-20.04" WSL2 instance with the name "MyCheckpoint". Checkpoints (vhdx) exist within the PnPWsl2/instance location under the "checkpoints" folder.

maml:description.maml:para: Copies a WSL 2 Instance to a new Instance.
This function allows you to copy an existing WSL 2 Instance to a new Instance with a specified name.
Specifies the name of the WSL 2 Instance to be copied. This parameter is mandatory.
Specifies the name of the new Instance to be created. This parameter is mandatory.
{{ Fill Force Description }}
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Specifies the name of the WSL 2 Instance to be copied. This parameter is mandatory.
Specifies the name of the new Instance to be created. This parameter is mandatory.
{{ Fill Force Description }}
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example copies the "Ubuntu-20.04" Instance to a new instance named "MyUbuntu".

maml:description.maml:para: Disables the Windows features 'VirtualMachinePlatform' and 'Microsoft-Windows-Subsystem-Linux'.

The Disable-PnPWsl2 function disables the Windows features 'VirtualMachinePlatform' and 'Microsoft-Windows-Subsystem-Linux'. It prompts the user for confirmation before disabling the features and also checks if the cmdlet is being run as an administrator. After disabling the features, it prompts the user to restart the machine.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Disables the telemetry for the PnP.WSL2 module.
The Disable-PnPWsl2Telemetry function is used to disable telemetry for PnP.WSL2 .
Enables the necessary features for running the Windows Subsystem for Linux 2 (WSL2).

The Enable-PnPWsl2 function enables the required features for running WSL2. It checks if the cmdlet is running with administrator privileges and then enables the 'Microsoft-Windows-Subsystem-Linux' and 'VirtualMachinePlatform' features. Finally, it restarts the computer to apply the changes.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Enables the telemetry for the PnP.WSL2 module.
The Enable-PnPWsl2Telemetry function is used to enable telemetry for PnP.WSL2 .
Exports a WSL2 instance to a file.
The `Export-PnPWsl2Instance` function exports a WSL2 instance to a file. The type of the file can be either a tar file or a VHD file.
The name of the WSL2 instance to export. This parameter is mandatory.
The type of the export file. It can be either "TarFile" or "VhdFile". This parameter is mandatory.
The path where the export file will be saved. This parameter is mandatory.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
The name of the WSL2 instance to export. This parameter is mandatory.
The type of the export file. It can be either "TarFile" or "VhdFile". This parameter is mandatory.
The path where the export file will be saved. This parameter is mandatory.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example exports the "Ubuntu-20.04" WSL2 instance to a tar file.
The export file will be saved in "/path/to/export".

maml:description.maml:para: This function retrieves a list of current available tools (Candy\scripts).
The Get-PnPWsl2Candy retrieves a list of current available tools (Candy\scripts).
A switch parameter that determines whether to include the FullPath property in the output. If this parameter is provided, FullPath is included.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
A switch parameter that determines whether to include the FullPath property in the output. If this parameter is provided, FullPath is included.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command retrieves a list of current available tools (Candy\scripts).

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves a list of checkpoints of a WSL2 instance.
The Get-PnPWsl2CheckPoint function retrieves the checkpoints of a specified WSL2 instance.
Specifies the WSL2 instance to get the checkpoints from. This parameter is mandatory.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Specifies the WSL2 instance to get the checkpoints from. This parameter is mandatory.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command retrieves a list of checkpoints of the "Ubuntu-20.04" WSL2 instance.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves the configuration settings for PnPWsl2.

The Get-PnPWsl2Configuration function retrieves the configuration settings for PnPWsl2. It displays basic information about the configuration, such as the PnPWsl2 root folder, WSL tools folder, and WSL images root folder. If the -detailed switch parameter is specified, it also displays the replace parameters and used internal WSL functions.
Specifies whether to display detailed information about the configuration. If this switch parameter is specified, the replace parameters and WSL functions will be displayed.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Specifies whether to display detailed information about the configuration. If this switch parameter is specified, the replace parameters and WSL functions will be displayed.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-PnPWsl2Configuration Retrieves and displays the basic configuration information for PnPWsl2.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-PnPWsl2Configuration -details Retrieves and displays detailed configuration information for PnPWsl2, including replace parameters and WSL functions.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves the WSL2 distributions.
This function retrieves the WSL2 distributions based on the specified parameters.
Specifies the name of the WSL2 instance.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Specifies the name of the WSL2 instance.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-PnPWsl2Distribution Retrieves all online WSL2 distributions.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-PnPWsl2Distribution -instanceName "Ubuntu-20.04" Retrieves the WSL2 distribution with the specified instance name.

maml:description.maml:para: Displays a basic help message for the PnP.WSL2 module.

The Get-PnPWsl2Help function retrieves the module configuration and displays a small screen with the title and description of the configuration. It then generates a basic information message about the PnP.WSL2 module and its available commands.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-PnPWsl2Help Displays a basic help message for the PnP.WSL2 module.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves the instances of WSL2 distributions.
This function retrieves the instances of WSL2 distributions.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-PnPWsl2Instance Retrieves the local WSL2 instances distributions.

maml:description.maml:para: This function retrieves the status of the PnP.WSL2 telemetry.
The Get-PnPWsl2Telemetry function checks the environment and retrieves the status of the PnP.WSL2 telemetry.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command will retrieve the status of the PnP.WSL2 telemetry

maml:description.maml:para: Imports a WSL2 Instance from a tar file (zip file).
The Import-PnPWsl2Instance function imports a WSL2 Instance from a tar file (zip file) and creates a new Instance with the specified name.
The name of the new Instance.
The path to the Instance file File can be either a tar file or a VHD file.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
The path to the Instance file File can be either a tar file or a VHD file.
The name of the new Instance.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Import-PnPWsl2Instance -InstanceFile "C:\path\to\Instance.tar" -Instance "MyInstance" Imports the WSL2 Instance from the specified tar file (zip file) and creates a new Instance named "MyInstance".

maml:description.maml:para: Invokes a Bash script in a WSL 2 Instance.
The Invoke-PnPWsl2Script function is used to execute a Bash script in a WSL 2 Instance. It takes the script base name and the target WSL 2 Instance as mandatory parameters.
The Bash script path to be executed.
The target WSL 2 Instance where the script will be executed. Use the ValidateWslLocalInstance argument completer to provide valid Instance names.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
The Bash script path to be executed.
The target WSL 2 Instance where the script will be executed. Use the ValidateWslLocalInstance argument completer to provide valid Instance names.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example invokes the Bash script named "MyScript.sh" in the "Ubuntu-20.04" WSL 2 Instance.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes a PnP WSL2 instance.

The Remove-PnPWsl2Instance cmdlet removes a specified PnP WSL2 instance. It requires the name of the instance as a mandatory parameter. The cmdlet validates the instance name before attempting to remove it. If the -Force switch is not provided, it prompts for confirmation before removing the instance.
The name of the PnP WSL2 instance to remove. This parameter is mandatory and accepts pipeline input.
If this switch is provided, the cmdlet does not prompt for confirmation before removing the instance.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
The name of the PnP WSL2 instance to remove. This parameter is mandatory and accepts pipeline input.
If this switch is provided, the cmdlet does not prompt for confirmation before removing the instance.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: # Remove a PnP WSL2 instance named "MyInstance" Remove-PnPWsl2Instance -Instance "MyInstance"

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: # Remove a PnP WSL2 instance named "MyInstance" without prompting for confirmation Remove-PnPWsl2Instance -Instance "MyInstance" -Force

maml:description.maml:para: Restores a PnP WSL2 instance from a checkpoint.

The Restore-PnPWsl2Instance cmdlet restores a specified PnP WSL2 instance from a checkpoint. It requires the name of the instance and the checkpoint as mandatory parameters. The cmdlet validates the instance name and the checkpoint before attempting to restore. If the instance name or the checkpoint is invalid, it throws an error. If the -Force switch is not provided, it prompts for confirmation before restoring the instance.
The name of the PnP WSL2 instance to restore. This parameter is mandatory and does not accept pipeline input. The cmdlet validates the instance name using the ValidateWslLocalInstance function.
If this switch is provided, the cmdlet does not prompt for confirmation before restoring the instance.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
The name of the PnP WSL2 instance to restore. This parameter is mandatory and does not accept pipeline input. The cmdlet validates the instance name using the ValidateWslLocalInstance function.
If this switch is provided, the cmdlet does not prompt for confirmation before restoring the instance.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: # Restore a PnP WSL2 instance named "MyInstance" from a checkpoint named "MyCheckpoint" Restore-PnPWsl2Instance -Instance "MyInstance" -CheckPoint "MyCheckpoint"

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: # Restore a PnP WSL2 instance named "MyInstance" from a checkpoint named "MyCheckpoint" without prompting for confirmation Restore-PnPWsl2Instance -Instance "MyInstance" -CheckPoint "MyCheckpoint" -Force

maml:description.maml:para: Stops the WSL2 service.
The Stop-PnPWsl2 cmdlet stops the WSL2 service if it is currently running.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command stops the WSL2 service.

maml:description.maml:para: Stops a WSL2 instance.
The Stop-PnPWsl2Instance cmdlet stops a running WSL2 instance. The instance to stop is specified by the Instance parameter.
Specifies the instance to stop. This parameter is mandatory and accepts only valid WSL2 instance names.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Specifies the instance to stop. This parameter is mandatory and accepts only valid WSL2 instance names.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command stops the WSL2 instance named "MyInstance".
